text: Nidara marcus is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Watson in 1965. It is found in Madagascar.Afro Moths The length of the forewings is 14-15.5 mm. The ground colour of both wings is yellow, the forewings speckled with very dark greyish brown apically and sometimes diffusely marked antemedial fascia and postmedial fascia. There is a white spot inside the distal end of the cell, a second white spot close to the cell and a third white spot, as well as several very dark greyish brown striations between the costa and the cell. The hindwings are unmarked.A revision of the Ethiopian Drepanidae (Lepidoptera) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1965 Category:Drepaninae
